comment._content: Chemical fire engine for small fires, see justacarguy.blogspot.ch/2011/07/dayton-tri-car-chemical-f...

comment.author: 76721888@N05
comment._content: Love the nostalgia of this picture.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From www.thunderpress.net/motorcycle-touring/three-for-the-roa... "One of the more interesting fore-cars of the era was the 1914 “Dayton Tri-Car.” Also known as the Dayton Chemical Fire Fighting Unit, it carried 100 feet of hose, 35 gallons of chemical fire retardant, two three-gallon hand extinguishers, a pick ax, crowbar, two lanterns, a 12-foot extension ladder, and reserves of both sulfuric acid and soda. Powered by a 9 hp Spacke twin, it also carried two men and could reach a speed of 45 mph."

comment.author: 35607158@N06
comment._content: I notice that "Dayton" notwithstanding, the location of the company is given as New York. So perhaps the Swedish Hospital in question is this www.brownstoner.com/blog/2011/09/past-and-present-the-swe...
